definition: doubts and suspicions/a maze of doubts/puzzle/mystery
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: You can not doubt your own existence.
sentences.chinese: 此种疑团，当不会如此长久存在。

sentences.english: When he read the letter, his doubts cleared away.
The doubt was still unsolved after his repeated explanations.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他一再解释疑团仍然存在。

sentences.english: There are, however, still some puzzles to be uncoiled.
sentences.chinese: 但是还有一些疑团没有解决。

sentences.english: As the mists cleared from my brain, I latched on to their conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我脑中的疑团消释了，便注意地听他们交谈。

sentences.english: A sudden doubt came to my mind.
He cleared up the question of his absence in the presence of all his classmates.
sentences.chinese: 他当着全班同学的面澄清了他缺席的疑团。

sentences.english: Can ravel out what's in my head．
sentences.chinese: 定能解开我头脑中的疑团。

sentences.english: And I don't know how to see my way through.
sentences.chinese: 我也不知道该如何解开这些疑团。

definition: a haze of doubts and suspicions
a matter that gnaws at one's mind/preoccupation/sore point/rancor
hard to solve/hard to dispel/hard to understand/hard to undo
see 謎兒|谜儿[mei4 r5], riddle
pending a decision/hanging in the balance
sth one wishes to keep secret/ulterior motive/a subject best avoided
to dispel doubts/to clear up difficulties
